page.title: 10Lostock Hall Carnival
page.content: The Lostock hall Carnival started in 1980. Its aim is to unite the community raise money for local charities. When thing area was reorganised it was thought to be a good time to re-start the August carnival after 25 years. A committee was formed bylocal traders to find ways of financing the carnival. Fund raising events are held and a carnial paper is distributed. On carnival day there are street collections and site rental for stall ho. After paying costs a profit of betw $1000 and $1200 is shared between local charities. The lorries are provided by local firms and are decorated by groups for the 2 mile walk through the village. Entry is free and open to all. Individuals can enter the fancy dress secrion. The fair isheld on the playing fields.
